titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Norman Hurd Ricker Papers, 1916-1978 MS 398

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-05-27 15:44:30 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Norman Hurd Ricker Papers
did.abstract: The Ricker Papers include the notes and papers related to physicist Norman Hurd Ricker's work in industrial research and in his academic career. The 25 boxes contain Ricker's autobiography, published papers, photographs depicting his experience at Rice University and many of his field expeditions, as well as notes, calculations, and graphs in various media, used in his research and writing.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Norman Hurd Ricker (1896-1980) was raised in Galveston and Albany, Texas, and was a member of Rice's first freshman and first graduating class. After receiving his doctorate in 1920 (the first given in Physics by Rice), Ricker remained at the Institute for a year before leaving to pursue his career in industrial research, first at Western Electric (1920-1923), and later at Humble Oil Refining Company (1923-1927), Hughes Tool Company (1927-1938), and Carter Oil Company (1938-1959). He ended his career of seismic and geophysical exploration in 1959 to return to academic life, taking a professorship of physics at the University of Oklahoma at Norman (1959-1980). Listed among his inventions are the paper cone loudspeaker and equipment for Texas's first deep oil wells, including the plunger lift pump for drilling. He is the author of numerous articles and a book, Transient Waves in Visco-Elastic Media. See Sallyport, April 1978.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Norman Hurd Ricker Papers, composed of 24 document boxes and one Hollinger box, include the notes and papers related to Ricker's work in industrial research and his academic career. The boxes contain Ricker's autobiography, published papers, photographs depicting his experience at Rice and many of his field expeditions, as well as notes, calculations, and graphs in various media, used in his research and writing. The materials have maintained the structure in which they were received from Ricker's files.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no accessrestrictions; this material is open for research. Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Norman Hurd Ricker Papers must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Norman Hurd Ricker Papers were received by Rice from three sources: from Ricker, who gave his Autobiography to the Woodson in May, 1978; from his son, Norman H. Ricker, Jr., who sent a group of photographs in November, 1985; and from his daughter, Florence Ricker Cloudt, who donated six boxes containing notes and papers, many related to Ricker's Wavelet Theory of Seismography, in April, 1986, and two boxes containing glass slides, in December, 1986.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Norman Hurd Ricker Papers are arranged in four series replicating Ricker's own filing system.
Note that one item in box 24 and all items in box 25 were deaccessioned in August 2009. The remaining items in box 24 were incorporated into box 23.

list.head: Missing Title
list.item: Series I. Bound and looseleaf notebooks.
Series III. Wavelet Theory of Seismography.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Notes in Ricker's hand concerning the contents of envelopes and files have been transcribed in the inventory, or photocopied and placed within the new enclosures.

Note that one item in box 24 and all items in box 25 were deaccessioned by archivist/special collection librarian Philip Montgomery in August 2009. The remaining items in box 24 were incorporated into box 23. The deaccessioned items were destroyed by mildew, breakage and improper storage. Box 24 contained a box of glass slides marked as mildewed. The box was deaccessioned, because the slides were damaged beyond repair. Box 25 contained a box of glass slides and a wooden plaque that were mildewed, broken and damaged beyond repair.

controlaccess.head: Subjects (Corporations)
controlaccess.corpname: Carter Oil. Jersey Production Research Center.
Humble Oil and Refining Company (Incorporated in Tex.).

did.unittitle: Series I: Looseleaf and Bound Notebooks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Containing graphs, computations, and papers in typescript and Ricker's hand.

did.unittitle: Looseleaf notebook containing correspondence and notes. Entitled, "A Treatise on the Mathematical Theory of Seismic Prospecting."
Bound notebook containing handwritten notes. Entitled, "Research Notebook No. 1 on the subject of `Our Dual World.'"
Bound notebook containing calculations on graph paper. Entitled, "Tabulation of Wavelet Functions and Other Functions Related Thereto."
Notebook containing graphs and notes grouped topically. Entitled, "Internal Friction Experiments (with torsion tube)."
Notebook containing two papers: May the Stokes Wave Equation Be Universal? and Stokes Wave Equation and the Propagation of a Plane Wave of Sand in a Simple Gas.
Rough draft of a paper entitled, The Propagation of Seismic Wavelets: Chapter I, Historical Introduction.

Notebook of computer printouts entitled, Computations of Wavelet Functions, Wavelet Form Functions and Hermite Functions with IBM Card Programme Computer, by Use of Series Development, Plane and Spherical Wave Surfaces.
Notebook containing onionskin carbon copies of the first 100 pages of vol. I of the Autobiography of Norman Hurd Ricker.
Correspondence with the Center for History and Philosophy of Physics, and the American Institute of Physics. Also, notes entitled, General Theory of Wavelet Contraction.
Notebook containing a rough draft of Seismic Wavelets: Being an Account of the Propagation of Transient Disturbances in Visco-Elastic Media.

Notebooks containing the fiscal report for the Air Force Cambridge Research Laboratories, Office of Aerospace Research. Entitled, The Propagation of Ultrasonic Elastic Waves in Solid Bodies and in Granular Media.
Reprint of The Form and Laws of Propagation of Seismic Wavelets, comments made on the paper at the Third World Petroleum Congress, and Ricker's replies.
Typewritten copy of a paper by F. P. Murraghan of Johns Hopkins U entitled, On the Finite Deformations of an Elastic Solid.
Notebook containing a hand-drawn map of Vietnam, some news-clippings, and Ricker's notes on how tunnels used by the Viet Cong could be located by means of geophysical prospecting methods.
Bound notebook containing notes from a seminar, Wave Propagation and Energy Dissipation. Norman, OK.
Typewritten copy of a paper by Francis A. Collins and C. C. Lee entitled, Seismic Wave Attenuation Characteristics from Pulse Experiments.
Bound handwritten draft of An Introduction to the Mathematical Theory of the Earthwaves Geophysical Prospecting Method.
Bound personal diary on Fundamental Seismic Studies, carried out by Party 8: Experimental Seismic Party. Started at Limon, Colo.
Looseleaf notebooks of reviews and correspondence regarding Transient Waves in Visco-Elastic Media.
Looseleaf notebook containing notes on the Interchange of Energy Between Particles as Described by the Stokes Wave Equation.
Looseleaf notebook containing notes and graphs concerning wavelet theory.
Looseleaf notebook containing notes, graphs, and calculations concerning wavelet theory.
Reprint from the proceedings of the Third World Petroleum Congress: The Form and Laws of Propagation of Seismic Wavelets.
Reprint of A Rational Approach to the Design of Electrical Filters and of Shot-Hole and Geophone Patterns in Seismic Reflection Prospecting, by F. Muir and F. W. Hales.
Published programs for the Semicentennial and Academic Festival of Rice University. Also, program for the International Conference on Fast Neutron Physics
Bound correspondence regarding The Form and Laws of Propagation of Seismic Wavelets.
Handwritten rough draft of Notes on Gravitation.
Collection of News Report of the National Academy of Sciences, (vol. VX, no. 1) - (vol. XVIII, no. 2).

odd.p: Items in folder: Series of files marked, "Wavelet Form Functions and the Laws of Propagation of Seismic Wavelets." Includes film negatives and charts. n.d.; Prints and negatives marked, "Obsolete."; Stencils for Wavelet forms.; Prints marked, "Chapter V: Wavelet Form Functions and the Laws of Propagation of Seismic Wavelets."; Series of files marked, "VI: Very-Near-Shot Wavelet Forms and the Nature of the Shot Pulse." Includes graphs marked, "Computation of Very-Near-Shot Forms by Graphical Integration."; Film negatives marked, "Wavelet Propagation."; Film overlays marked, "Near Shot Forms."; Film negatives marked, "Wavelet Form Functions; Step function & spike function excitation."; Prints marked, "Peak Amplitudes - Very Near Shot"; Film negatives marked, "Very-Near-Shot Wavelet Forms"; Prints marked, "Displacement form; old."; Prints marked, "Velocity form"; Charts and graph marked, "Integration of Displacement form"; Notebook containing graphs and prints. Entitled, "The Nature of the Shot-Pulse"; Prints marked, "Chapter VI: Very near shot wavelet forms and the true nature of the shot pulse."; Series of files marked, "VII: Seismic Ray Paths." Includes notes and graphs marked, "Earth with uniform velocity gradient."; Series of files marked, "VIII: Some Characteristics of Seismic Disturbances." Includes graphs and prints.; Film negatives marked, "Seismic First Motion."; Prints, graphs, and overlays marked, "Seismic First Motion."; "An original Seismogram: Minden, Louisiana."; Series of files marked, "IX: Wavelet Complexes and Seismic Resolving Power." Includes film negatives and graphs.; Prints,; Graphs marked, "Original Plotted Data; Two-Wavelet Complex"; Charts of data.; Graphs and charts marked, "The Wavelet Complex"; Graphs marked, "Synthetic Wavelet Complexes; Calculations and Curves"; Graphs marked, "Wavelet Complex Computations"; Graphs and charts marked, "Two-Wavelet complex"; Notebook containing graphs. Entitled, "The Wavelet Complex"; Notebook containing graphs. Entitled, "Gibson Zone Wavelet Complex. Katie Area, Oklahoma"; Notebook containing calculations. Entitled, "Formulae from Wavelet Theory; Appendix C"; Graphs and charts marked, "Two Wavelet Complex"; Prints.; Film negatives marked, "Wavelet Complexes"; Prints and positive film overlays marked, "Wavelet Complexes"

did.unittitle: Prints, notes, and calculations dealing with wavelet theory.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Items in folder: Series of files marked, "X: Distortionless Wavelet Transmission." Includes prints and calculations.; Report marked, "Theory of Wavelet Contraction"; Prints marked, "Spectrum of Seismic Wavelet"; Prints marked, "How W. C. Characteristic Contracts Wavelet by Modifying Spectrum"; Film negatives marked, "Wavelet-Spectra"; Graph and calculations marked, "Spectrum of a Wavelet"; Prints marked, "Chapter X: Wavelet Spectrum and the Requirements for Distortionless Wavelet Transmission"; Series of files marked, "XI: The Seismograph." Includes notes.; Prints and charts marked, "Seismograph and Galvanometer"; Film negatives marked, "Seismograph and galvanometer response curves"; Graphs and computations marked, "Response of a Seismograph to Impressed Wavelet form; Harmonic Function Approach (Superceded by Wavelet Function Approach)"; Prints and graphs marked, "seismograph response curves"; Series of files marked, "XII: The Galvanometer." Includes prints and graph.; Charts marked, "Galvanometer Response to True Wavelet Input"; Film negatives marked, "Galvanometer Response, halftone"; Prints and graphs marked, "Galvanometer Response Characteristics"; Prints marked, "Oscillograms of Galvanometer Output forms for True Wavelet Inputs"; Series of files marked, "XIII: Laboratory Studies of Wavelet Contraction." Includes originals and stencils for wavelet generator.; Film negative marked, "Wavelet Contractor Circuit"; Graphs marked, "Resolution of Wavelet Complex by Wavelet Contraction"; Prints marked, "Laboratory Studies of W. C. Prints"; Notebook containing handwritten notes and prints. Entitled, "Data from Wavelet Contraction Notebook."; Charts marked, "Wavelet Contraction Frequency Allocations"; Handwritten notes marked, "Laboratory Studies of Wavelet Contraction and Seismic Resolution"; Series of files marked, "XIV: Field Studies with the Wavelet Contractor." Includes prints and notes marked, "Comparison of Wavelet Contractor Seismogram with Conventional Seismogram. El Reno, Okla."; Print marked, "Experimental Time Delays; W. C. Amplifiers"; Charts marked, "Wavelet Breadth"; Prints marked, "Resolution Wavelet Complex; Switch Positions 24 to 17"; Prints marked, "Delay Time Wavelet Contractor"; Charts marked, "Wavelet Contractor Type E Time delay Observations"; Prints marked, "Calculated Out Forms for Wavelet Input of Arbitrary W. C. Characteristics"; Print marked, "Allocation of Frequencies to W. C. Switch Positions"; Prints marked, "Ground Roll Suppression - Contraction Ratio"; Notes, both typed and handwritten, marked, "Wavelet Contractor Operating Truck and Equipment; Specifications and Ideas"; Typed notes related to "Wavelet Contractor Conference: Sept. 30, 1947"; Film negatives marked, "Wavelet Contractor"; Prints marked, "Original W. C. Oscillograms from which slides were made"; Charts marked, "Contours drawn on transition frequency"; Series of files marked, "XV: Experimental Studies of the Primary Seismic Disturbance." Includes notes and graphs marked, "Amplitude vs. Charge Size"; Charts marked, "Breadth Squared and Transition - Frequency Contours in Section Limon and Last Chance, Colo."; Charts marked, "Original Data"; Charts marked, "Wave Surface; Limon and Last Chance, Colo."; Prints marked, "Wavelet Spectra - Comparison Observed with Ideal; Limon, Colo."; Prints marked, "All Primary Forms; Last Chance, Colo."; Charts marked, "Primary Forms; Limon, Colo."; Charts marked, "Variation of Form; Limon, Colo."; Prints marked, "Photos of Specimen Seismograms; Limon, Colo."; Prints marked, "Seismic First Motion"; Film negative marked, "Nine Primary Forms at Limon, Colo."; Film negatives marked, "Wavelet-Breadth vs. Travel Time; Refinery Residue Wax."; Drawings on tracing cloth marked, "Seismic Punch vs. Shot Depth; Limon and Last Chance, Colo."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Containing the bound copy of Vol. 1 of The Autobiography of Norman Hurd Ricker, several photograph albums, boxes of glass slides, and scientific equipment.
Note that one item in box 24 and all items in box 25 were deaccessioned in August 2009. The remaining items in box 24 were incorporated into box 23.

did.unittitle: Two artifacts

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Items in folder: Headphones; Unidentified machinery
